topPRs.title: feat(auth): implement JWT authentication and user management
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Relates to

- Data isolation / multi-entity support
- External JWT provider integration (Privy, Auth0, Clerk, Supabase, Google, Embbeded)

## Risks

**Low**

- Requires `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true` to activate JWT auth mode

## Background

### What does this PR do?

Implements a complete JWT authentication system for ElizaOS with support for multiple verification strategies:

1. **JWT Verifier Factory** - Priority-based verifier selection:
   - Ed25519 (highest priority) - For self-signed JWTs with Ed25519 keys
   - JWKS (medium priority) - For external providers (Auth0, Clerk, Privy, Supabase, Google)
   - Secret (lowest priority) - For simple HS256 symmetric key verification

2. **Entity ID derivation from JWT `sub` claim**:
   - `entityId = stringToUuid(payload.sub)`
   - Compatible with ANY JWT provider since `sub` is a standard claim
   - No custom claims needed in external JWTs

3. **Dual authentication modes**:
   - `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true` ‚Üí JWT authentication required
   - `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=false` ‚Üí X-Entity-Id header (legacy mode)

4. **Internal service bypass** - Process-local UUID secret for service-to-service calls

5. **Credentials-based auth endpoints** (`/api/auth/*`) - only in custom - JWT-SECRET mode:
   - `POST /register` - User registration with bcrypt password hashing
   - `POST /login` - User login with JWT generation
   - `POST /refresh` - Token refresh
   - `GET /me` - Current user info

6. **Client UI default implementation using self mode (Secret)

### What kind of change is this?

**Features** (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

## Architecture

```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ                    JWT Verification Flow                         ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ  Request with Bearer token                                       ‚îÇ
‚îÇ       ‚Üì                                                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  JWTVerifierFactory.create()                                     ‚îÇ
‚îÇ       ‚Üì                                                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Priority: Ed25519 > JWKS > Secret > Disabled                   ‚îÇ
‚îÇ       ‚Üì                                                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  verifier.verify(token)                                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ       ‚Üì                                                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Extract payload.sub                                             ‚îÇ
‚îÇ       ‚Üì                                                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  entityId = stringToUuid(sub)  ‚Üê Derived, NOT stored in JWT     ‚îÇ
‚îÇ       ‚Üì                                                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  req.entityId = entityId                                         ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## Environment Variables

| Variable | Description | Example |
|----------|-------------|---------|
| `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION` | Enable JWT auth mode | `true` |
| `JWT_SECRET` (optional) | HS256 symmetric secret | `your-secret-key` |
| `JWT_PUBLIC_KEY_ED25519` (optional) | Ed25519 public key (base64) | `MCowBQYDK2Vw...` |
| `JWT_JWKS_URI` (optional) | JWKS endpoint URL | `https://auth0.com/.well-known/jwks.json` |
| `JWT_ISSUER_WHITELIST` (optional) | Allowed issuers (comma-separated) | `https://auth0.com/,https://clerk.dev` |

## Documentation changes needed?

Yes - Documentation should be added for:
- Environment variable configuration
- External provider setup (Auth0, Clerk, Privy examples)

## Testing

### Where should a reviewer start?

1. `packages/server/src/services/jwt-verifiers/factory.ts` - Core factory logic
2. `packages/server/src/middleware/jwtMiddleware.ts` - HTTP middleware
3. `packages/server/src/socketio/index.ts` - SocketIO authentication

### Detailed testing steps

**Unit Tests:**
```bash
cd packages/server
bun run test:unit
```

**Integration Tests:**
```bash
cd packages/server
bun run test:integration
```

**Results:** 489 unit tests pass, 6 integration test files pass

### Manual Testing

1. **Test with JWT_SECRET (HS256):**
```bash
ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true JWT_SECRET=test-secret bun run dev
```

2. **Register a user:**
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/auth/register \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email":"test@example.com","username":"testuser","password":"password123"}'
```

3. **Use returned token:**
```bash
curl http://localhost:3000/api/agents \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```

## External Provider Compatibility

Tested JWT formats:
- **Auth0**: `sub: "auth0|1234567890"`
- **Clerk**: `sub: "user_2abcdefgh123456"`
- **Google**: `sub: "1234567890"` with `email`, `email_verified`
- **Supabase**: `sub: "uuid"` with `role: "authenticated"`
- **Privy**: `sub: "did:privy:..."`

All providers work because we only require the standard `sub` claim.

## Next Idea Steps: Access Control Layer (ACL)

The next phase will add access control on agents and rooms: 

Agents:
- Each user can create their own agents (ownerId = entityId)
- Visibility: public or private
- Private = only the owner can chat with it
- Public = everyone can chat, but only the owner can modify/delete

Rooms:
- Each room has an owner
Only the owner can:
- Delete the room (DELETE /rooms/:id)
- Clear message history (DELETE /rooms/:id/messages)
- Change visibility

This will enable true multi-tenant mode where each user manages their resources in isolation.

topPRs.title: [DRAFT] feat(core): Implement parallel action execution in processActions
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR implements parallel action execution within the `processActions()` method to improve performance for multi-action responses.

## Changes

### Core Runtime (`packages/core/src/runtime.ts`)
- Execute actions within a single response batch **in parallel** using `Promise.allSettled()`
- All actions in a batch receive the **same initial state snapshot**
- State accumulates **sequentially between response batches**
- Merge all `ActionResult.values` after parallel batch completes
- Preserve fault tolerance: if one action fails, others still complete

### Prompts (`packages/core/src/prompts.ts`)
- Updated `messageHandlerTemplate` to reflect parallel execution model
- Changed "IMPORTANT ACTION ORDERING RULES" to "IMPORTANT ACTION EXECUTION RULES"
- Clarified that actions listed in a single response execute in parallel
- Added guidance to use multi-step workflow for sequential dependencies

### Action State Provider (`packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/actionState.ts`)
- Updated JSDoc and description to clarify "previous results" refers to prior response batches, not sibling parallel actions

### Tests
- Updated `runtime.test.ts` to match new state initialization behavior
- Updated `prompts.test.ts` to match new prompt text

## Key Data Flow

```
Response 1: [action1, action2, action3]
  ‚îú‚îÄ> Execute ALL in parallel with initialState
  ‚îú‚îÄ> Wait for all to complete
  ‚îî‚îÄ> Merge results ‚Üí accumulatedState

Response 2: [action4, action5]
  ‚îú‚îÄ> Execute ALL in parallel with accumulatedState from Response 1
  ‚îú‚îÄ> Wait for all to complete
  ‚îî‚îÄ> Merge results ‚Üí new accumulatedState
```

## Testing

- All existing runtime tests pass
- All prompt tests pass
- All multi-step workflow tests pass
- Action chaining tests pass

## Breaking Changes

None - backward compatible. Actions that previously assumed sequential execution within a batch will now run in parallel, but since they all receive the same state snapshot, behavior should be equivalent for independent actions.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Execute actions in a response batch in parallel with a shared state snapshot, accumulate results across batches, and introduce AsyncLocalStorage-based prompt tracking with prompt/provider/test updates.
> 
> - **Core (runtime.ts)**:
>   - Parallelize `processActions` per response using `Promise.allSettled()`; each batch shares a composed state snapshot; accumulate `ActionResult.values` and plan state between batches.
>   - Add robust action resolution (exact/fuzzy/similes), error paths for missing action/handler, and consistent action memory/logging.
>   - Preserve legacy returns (void/boolean) as completed; treat `{ success:false }` (including minimal/error-only) as failed.
>   - Merge working memory with size cap; cache `action_results`; update action plan immutably per step.
>   - Introduce AsyncLocalStorage context: `ActionContextStore`, `getCurrentActionContext`, and browser fallback `createBrowserFallback` for prompt collection; include action context in `useModel` logs; skip collecting `TEXT_EMBEDDING` prompts.
> - **Prompts (prompts.ts)**:
>   - Update `messageHandlerTemplate` for parallel execution model and guidance on multi-step dependencies.
> - **Provider (plugin-bootstrap/actionState.ts)**:
>   - Clarify description/docs: "previous results" are from prior response batches; parallel actions share the same snapshot.
> - **Tests**:
>   - Expand `runtime.test.ts`: parallel execution behavior, action result status semantics, prompt collection/isolation via AsyncLocalStorage, browser fallback behavior, exact vs fuzzy action matching.
>   - Update `prompts.test.ts` for new execution rules and wording.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 55765fc289c965232d5d690c363f73c7ea1b81f6. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: refactor(server): optimization and reorganization
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Risks

**Low to Medium**

- Socket.IO configuration changes may affect existing client connections (tested with multiple browsers)
- Code reorganization changes import paths - all imports have been updated and verified

# Background

## What does this PR do?

This PR addresses server performance issues (request timeouts ~30s with multiple users connections) and improves code organization following clean architecture principles.

### Performance Optimizations

1. **Socket.IO Configuration**
   - Configured `pingInterval` (25s) and `pingTimeout` (20s)
   - Set `connectTimeout` (10s)
   - Enforced transport order: `['websocket', 'polling']`

2. **HTTP Server Timeouts**
   - Added `timeout`, `keepAliveTimeout`, `headersTimeout`, `requestTimeout`
   - Prevents hanging connections

3. **Socket Disconnection Guards**
   - Added checks before emitting to sockets
   - Graceful handling of disconnected clients

4. **Parallel Database Operations**
   - Used `Promise.all` for independent DB queries
   - Reduces latency for multi-query endpoints

### Code Reorganization

Restructured root-level files into proper directories:

| Before | After |
|--------|-------|
| `src/bus.ts` | `src/services/message-bus.ts` |
| `src/loader.ts` | `src/services/loader.ts` |
| `src/upload.ts` | `src/utils/upload.ts` |
| `src/types.ts` | `src/types/server.ts` |
| *(new)* | `src/utils/config.ts` |
| *(new)* | `src/services/index.ts` |

- Added `ServerMiddleware` and `ServerConfig` types to `types/server.ts`
- Created barrel exports in `services/index.ts` and updated `utils/index.ts`
- Maintained backward compatibility via re-exports in `src/index.ts`

### Test Fixes

- Fixed invalid UUID usage in integration tests (replaced string casts with `stringToUuid()`)
- Updated import paths for relocated modules

## What kind of change is this?

- Improvements (performance optimizations)
- Refactoring (code reorganization)
- Bug fixes (test UUID issues)

# Documentation changes needed?

No

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. [src/index.ts](packages/server/src/index.ts) - Main entry point with Socket.IO and HTTP timeout configs
2. [src/services/](packages/server/src/services/) - Reorganized service files

## Detailed testing steps

1. Run unit tests and integrations tests:
   ```bash
   cd packages/server && bun run test:unit && bun run test:integration
   ```

2. Run build:
   ```bash
   cd packages/server && bun run build
   ```

3. Manual testing:
   - Start server with PostgreSQL
   - Connect multiple browser tabs simultaneously
   - Verify no timeout errors after 30s
   - Test Socket.IO reconnection behavior

topPRs.title: feat: bump deps, fix drizzle-kit across ecosystem
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
## üîÑ Update All Dependencies to Latest Versions

### Problem

Found conflicting `drizzle-orm` versions across the monorepo causing compatibility issues:

- `drizzle-orm@0.45.0` (root)
- `drizzle-orm@0.44.7` (from `@elizaos/plugin-sql`)
- `drizzle-orm@0.38.4` (from `@elizaos/plugin-memory`)
- `drizzle-kit@0.31.x` which is **not compatible** with `drizzle-orm@0.44+`

### Solution

Updated all packages across the monorepo to their latest compatible versions to ensure consistency and resolve dependency conflicts.

### Key Updates

| Package | Before | After |
|---------|--------|-------|
| `bun` | 1.2.21 | 1.3.4 |
| `typescript` | 5.8.x - 5.9.2 | 5.9.3 |
| `zod` | 3.x - 4.1.11 | 4.1.13 |
| `drizzle-orm` | 0.44.2 | 0.45.0 |
| `prettier` | 3.5.3 - 3.6.2 | 3.7.4 |
| `vite` | 6.x - 7.1.7 | 7.2.6 |
| `react` / `react-dom` | 18.3.1 | 19.1.0 |
| `lerna` | 9.0.0 | 9.0.3 |
| `turbo` | 2.5.5 | 2.6.3 |

### Packages Updated

- ‚úÖ Root `package.json`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/core`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/cli` (+ added `@elizaos/plugin-ollama`)
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/client`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/server`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-sql`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/api-client`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/service-interfaces`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/test-utils`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-starter`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-quick-starter`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-dummy-services`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/project-starter`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/project-tee-starter`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/app`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/config`

### Testing

```bash
bun outdated  # Returns empty - all packages up to date
bun install   # Completes successfully
```

### Notes

- Version bumped `@elizaos/plugin-sql`, `@elizaos/server`, `@elizaos/client` to `1.6.5-alpha.22`
- The `whatwg-url@7.1.0` peer dependency in `plugin-bootstrap` is intentionally pinned for compatibility

topPRs.title: feat: Add ElizaOS Cloud as Default AI Provider in CLI
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
## Add ElizaOS Cloud as Default AI Provider in CLI

### Summary
- Add **ElizaOS Cloud** as the first/recommended option in `elizaos create` AI model selection
- Integrate browser-based login flow for seamless API key setup
- Fix env variable naming to match plugin (`ELIZAOS_CLOUD_API_KEY`)

### Changes

**`packages/cli/src/commands/create/utils/selection.ts`**
- Add ElizaOS Cloud as top option with "(Recommended)" label
- Set `elizacloud` as default `initialValue`
- Add `elizacloud` to `hasEmbeddingSupport()` list

**`packages/cli/src/utils/get-config.ts`**
- Add `storeElizaCloudKey()` and `promptAndStoreElizaCloudKey()` 
- Support 3 auth flows: browser login, manual key entry, skip

**`packages/cli/src/commands/create/actions/setup.ts`**
- Add `elizacloud` case in `setupAIModelConfig()`
- Map `elizacloud` ‚Üí `@elizaos/plugin-elizacloud` in `resolveModelToPlugin()`
- Skip Ollama fallback when using ElizaOS Cloud

**`packages/cli/src/commands/login/actions/login.ts`**
- Rename `ELIZA_CLOUD_API_KEY` ‚Üí `ELIZAOS_CLOUD_API_KEY`

### User Flow
```
‚óÜ  Which AI model would you like to use?
‚îÇ  ‚óè ElizaOS Cloud (Recommended)
‚îÇ  ‚óã Local AI (Ollama)
‚îÇ  ‚óã OpenAI
‚îÇ  ...

‚óÜ  How would you like to authenticate?
‚îÇ  ‚óè Login with browser (recommended)
‚îÇ  ‚óã Enter API key manually
‚îÇ  ‚óã Skip for now
```

### Test Plan
- [ ] Run `elizaos create test-project` and select ElizaOS Cloud
- [ ] Verify browser login flow saves key correctly
- [ ] Verify manual key entry works
- [ ] Verify plugin installs as `@elizaos/plugin-elizacloud`
- [ ] Verify skip option adds placeholder to `.env`
